meanings.definition: To shout or call out loudly to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The hunter hollooed to his dog to come back.
meanings.sent2: She hollooed for help when she got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The children hollooed with joy when they saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent4: His voice hollooed across the valley, echoing off the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The coach hollooed instructions to the players during the game.

meanings.definition: Past tense of holloo: to shout or call out loudly to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, he hollooed for his friend from across the street.
meanings.sent2: She hollooed in excitement when she won the race.
meanings.sent3: The cat hollooed at the birds outside the window.
meanings.sent4: His words hollooed through the empty hallways of the old castle.
meanings.sent5: The teacher hollooed the answer to the student's question from across the classroom.
